comments.creator: nrundy@hotmail.com
comments.author: nrundy@hotmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

Despite displaying on the print preview, page one of the linked page above will not print. Only page 2 prints. Page 1 prints out a blank page.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. navigate to http://itmanagement.earthweb.com/osrc/print.php/3930571
2. print out the article
3. notice how page 1 fails to print

Actual Results:  
only page 2 prints. Page 1 is a blank page only showing the header/footers.

Expected Results:  
I expected page 1 and page 2 to print

comments.raw_text: Page 1 prints off just fine on Internet Explorer 8 and Chrome.
comments.author: nrundy@hotmail.com
comments.text: Page 1 prints off just fine on Internet Explorer 8 and Chrome.

dholbert@mozilla.com
comments.text:
WORKSFORME on Ubuntu Linux
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110409 Firefox/4.2a1pre

I wonder if this depends on the specific page-splitting location (which varies between Windows & Linux due to print-margin & font-size differences)
comments.author: dholbert@mozilla.com

comments.creator: aravind@smartware.com
comments.text:
Confirmed on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110413 Firefox/6.0a1

Only Page 2 is printed, Page 1 is printed blank with only headers and footers.
In Firefox 3.6.16 Page 1 is printed and Page 2 is blank.

comments.author: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.text: I get 1 truncated page with Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:13.0) Gecko/20120313 Firefox/13.0a1 ID:20120313090404
comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: I get 1 truncated page with Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:13.0) Gecko/20120313 Firefox/13.0a1 ID:20120313090404

Still WORKSFORME in Ubuntu -- must be OS-specific (probably due to differences in font / margin metrics).

Setting Version to Trunk per comment 5, and confirming based on comment 4 & 5. (sounds like slightly different behavior between those comments, but both with truncation / missing data )
